candidates.title: Enable nightly builds for Python wheels
candidates.body:
Enables nightly builds for Python wheels via GitHub actions. Builds start at 12am Pacific (7am UTC) and take around 30 minutes to finish. Also updated the script for building wheels.

This should be merged after #143.

candidates.title: Updated crate dependencies.
candidates.body: Updated dependencies so that we can benefit from the newer Tokio features (e.g., https://tokio.rs/blog/2020-04-preemption).

candidates.title: Configure number of streams in bundles with environment variables
candidates.body:
Introduces `ERDOS_BUNDLE_MAX_READ_STREAMS` and `ERDOS_BUNDLE_MAX_WRITE_STREAMS` which parametrize the maximum number of read and write streams in bundle. This allows constructing bundles over more than the default number of read/write streams without modifying `build.rs`.

Other changes:
- Pylot compatibility:
  - `ERDOS_BUNDLE_MAX_READ_STREAMS` defaults to 20.
  - `ERDOS_BUNDLE_MAX_WRITE_STREAMS` defaults to 10.
- Logging in `build.rs`.
- Extend `make_callback_builder.py` to support up to 99 read/write streams.
- Configure `build.rs` to only re-run on build if `build.rs`, `make_callback_builder.py`, `make_add_watermark_callback_vec.py`, `ERDOS_BUNDLE_MAX_READ_STREAMS`, or `ERDOS_BUNDLE_MAX_WRITE_STREAMS` are changed.
- Add README section on build parameters.

It turns out that compiling generated code dominates build times, which is quadratic in the maximum number of read/write streams supported by bundles `O(ERDOS_BUNDLE_MAX_READ_STREAMS * ERDOS_BUNDLE_MAX_WRITE_STREAMS)`.
![erdos-build-time](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14067561/87897405-16d3a000-ca00-11ea-9a40-73ae66cc2acb.png)

candidates.title: [Rust] Fix new nightly errors
candidates.body:
- The Rust specialization feature rust-lang/rust#31844 is unsound and throws a warning on the latest nightly. This PR moves to min_specialization which fixes the warning.
   - [Forks abomonation](https://github.com/erdos-project/abomonation) in order to allow specialization on structs that implement `Abomonation`.
- Replaces use of `Vec::remove_item` to end reliance on the deprecated `vec_remove_item` feature.

candidates.title: Remove Eurosys throughput experiment and plotting scripts
Implement zero-copy communication
candidates.body:
- Adds zero-copy communication for operators colocated on the same node.
- Zero-copy mechanisms speed up cross-node communication by reducing copies on the communication path.
- Further speed up cross-node communication by serializing directly into the network buffer.
- Operators receive references to timestamps and messages rather than taking ownership to further reduce copies.

candidates.title: [Rust] Add latency benchmarks
candidates.body:
Adds latency benchmarks using criterion.

Also adds `erdos::reset` which resets the internal dataflow graph, allowing a program to stop a dataflow, reset the graph, and create new dataflow graph.

Contains some minor bugfixes as well.

In addition, ran the benchmarks on erdos4:
[report.zip](https://github.com/erdos-project/erdos/files/4384881/report.zip)

candidates.title: [Operators] Replace CHashMap with locked HashMap
candidates.body:
Also did some cleanup to reduce build warnings.

Fixes #100

candidates.title: Implement ExecutionLattice to partially order incoming events.
candidates.body:
- Adds a dependency to `petgraph` which provides the underlying directed acyclic graph implementation.
- Implements the `PartialOrd` trait for the OperatorEvent to partially order events based on their timestamps and watermark status.
- Implements the `ExecutionLattice` class that partially orders the incoming events and provides an API to retrieve the events that are safe to run.

candidates.title: Make pyo3 an optional dependency
candidates.body:
Minor fix which improves build time by making pyo3 an optional dependency. This improves build time when building the core system.

This PR doesn't change the build process; pyo3 is automatically included when building for python.

candidates.title: MapOperator and JoinOperator Implementation.
candidates.body: - This PR provides the implementation of MapOperator and JoinOperator along with the relevant tests.

candidates.title: Move streams and operator executor to Tokio
candidates.body:
- Avoids busy looping for invoking callbacks by moving streams and operator executor to tokio.
- Replaces std channels with tokio channels to prevent blocking of OS threads (which may cause starvation/block the entire runtime).
- Calls to `ReadStream::read` now busy loop, but don't interfere with the runtime. To solve this issue, we may want to move operators to tokio in the future, make `run` async, and implement an async `ReadStream::read`.
- Fixes a bug in the single node case where `Node::run_async` may finish running while operators should still be running.

Performance of `python/examples/watermarks.py` before fixes (note 3 CPUs at 100%):
![cpu_no_tokio](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14067561/74675960-b2b76200-5169-11ea-9a23-3d10a06405f9.png)

Performance of `python/examples/watermarks.py` before fixes (note 1 CPU at 100% due to `PullWatermarkListener`):
![cpu_tokio](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14067561/74675984-c4990500-5169-11ea-88c0-fea50a12d9cd.png)

chosen_pr.title: Enable nightly builds for Python wheels
chosen_pr.body:
Enables nightly builds for Python wheels via GitHub actions. Builds start at 12am Pacific (7am UTC) and take around 30 minutes to finish. Also updated the script for building wheels.

This should be merged after #143.

repo.name: erdos
